poem:
**Convergence of Greatness**  

Behold the craft—  
miners delve deep,  
earth's secrets for a price—  
magnets drawn like destiny  
to devices in palms.

Half a billion promises  
sealed,  
a dance of power  
between rock  
and silicon.  

The world spins,  
orbits change,  
America's heart aligns—  
rare metals, light  
as whispers,  
weight our dreams.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Apple inks $500m deal for rare earth magnets with US mining firm Apple has signed a $500m deal with a US firm for rare earth magnets, essential for manufacturing electronics, after China curbed exports of the scarce, vital materials. The backing from one of the world’s most valuable companies comes after MP Materials, which operates the only US rare earths mine, last week agreed to a multibillion-dollar deal with the US Department of Defense that". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
